title.narrative: SUR3.1 SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacity to systematically collect, analyse and use disaggregated data and other forms of information to monitor, inform policy decision-making and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of its dimensions, using an equity-based approach, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Economic And Social Policy General, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the life cycle and building their resilience through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies based on adequately disaggregated data on children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacity to systematically collect, analyse and use disaggregated data and other forms ofinformation to monitor, inform policy decision-making and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of itsdimensions, using an equity-based approach

description.narrative: Key focus of UNICEF Suriname was the mapping and strengthening of the national social protection systems strengthening, including in fragile and humanitarian contexts, with the aim to ensure public finance management systems are better equipped to finance social services for children in an equitable and efficient manner. While COVID-19 has resulted in both countries in having less resources allocated for addressing inequalities and making it more challenging to reach the more marginalized, continuous advocacy let get the focus back on addressing poverty, specifically child poverty | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2022
